intro: Melissa officinalis subvar. altissima, commonly known as lemon balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe, North Africa, and the西亚 region. It is characterized by its fragrant, lemon-scented leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, often growing in moist environments. Its leaves are rich in essential oils, particularly citral and geraniol, which contribute to its aromatic properties. It is widely cultivated for culinary, medicinal, and ornamental purposes.
